definition: big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
bloody mouth wide open like a sacrificial bowl (idiom); ferocious mouth of beast of prey/fig. greedy exploiter/rapacious aggressor

sentences.english: And a cola he quaffed named Fenhuang fizzled.
sentences.chinese: 一种他大口大口喝的可乐被称为“风花告吹”。

sentences.english: And a cola he quaffed named Fenhuang fizzled.
sentences.chinese: 一种他大口大口喝的可乐被称为“风花告吹”。

sentences.english: Smith kept swigging away at the bottle of brandy .
sentences.chinese: 史密斯对著那瓶白兰地酒大口地喝个不停。

sentences.english: Still excited, he stared at the orangeade in the glass, then tipped his head back and took several deep draughts.
sentences.chinese: 他兴奋不已地瞧了瞧桔子水，然后仰起头大口喝起来。

sentences.english: He was still hanging around, swigging the Coke out of the can.
sentences.chinese: 他还在闲逛，拿着一罐可乐大口大口地喝着。

sentences.english: He was still hanging around, swigging the Coke out of the can.
sentences.chinese: 他还在闲逛，拿着一罐可乐大口大口地喝着。

sentences.english: He hold some water and given a big drinking.
sentences.chinese: 他捧起水来喝了一大口。

sentences.english: The hungry boy gulped down the bowl of soup.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿的男孩大口大口地把那碗汤喝了下去。

sentences.english: The hungry boy gulped down the bowl of soup.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿的男孩大口大口地把那碗汤喝了下去。

sentences.english: She was vomiting mouthfuls of blood when neighbors carried her to the tricycle.
sentences.chinese: 邻居们把她抬上车时，她还在大口大口地吐着鲜血。

sentences.english: She was vomiting mouthfuls of blood when neighbors carried her to the tricycle.
sentences.chinese: 邻居们把她抬上车时，她还在大口大口地吐着鲜血。

sentences.english: My friend and I pretty rational, then rushed out of the blood-big mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我和朋友还算理性，于是匆忙走出了血盘大口。

sentences.english: Hansen quickly gulped a deep swallow of beer, then tabled the mug.
sentences.chinese: 汉森急喘地喝了一大口啤酒，然后把被子放回桌上。

sentences.english: After about a half mile, the boy stopped, breathing heavily. The game warden finally caught up to him.
sentences.chinese: 大概跑到一英里外，男孩停下来，大口大口的喘着气。

sentences.english: After about a half mile, the boy stopped, breathing heavily. The game warden finally caught up to him.
sentences.chinese: 大概跑到一英里外，男孩停下来，大口大口的喘着气。
龙的血盆大口分外显眼，显然是一只凶险的野兽。

definition: sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
bloody mouth wide open like a sacrificial bowl (idiom); ferocious mouth of beast of prey/fig. greedy exploiter/rapacious aggressor
spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
